entry.title: WINSTON-DILLARD HYDRANT FLOW TESTING BEGINS APRIL 1ST
entry.summary: March 26, 2024 10:20 a.m. The Winston-Dillard Fire District will be doing its annual hydrant flow testing starting April 1st. During this testing water could become discolored. That condition is rare and should clear up quickly. Customers who notice excessive discoloration should notify the district at 679-8721 or 679-8467.

entry.title: Certified Burn Manager Advisory Committee meets April 8
entry.summary:
SALEM, Ore. — The Certified Burn Manager Advisory Committee will meet virtually on Monday, April 8, 2024, from 9 a.m. to noon. To join, please use the Zoom video conference information found on the agenda. The committee’s agenda includes:
Welcome and introductions CBM website updates CBM rule revisions Training providers and curriculum development Instructor guide Field certification books Updates Past and future course deliveries Legislation ODF prescribed fire policy development
The meeting is open to the public to attend virtually. There will be a period for public comment. Requests for an interpreter for the hearing impaired or other accommodations for persons with disabilities should be made at least 48 hours before the meeting by contacting Shelby Berry at 503-949-5181. View more information on the CBMAC webpage.

entry.title: Livestock conference coming April 10
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Douglas County Spring Livestock Conference and Expo will be held from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. April 10 at the Douglas County Fairgrounds.

entry.title: Six Oregon communities receive grants from Oregon Community Trees to boost Arbor Month celebrations (Photo)
entry.summary:
SALEM, Ore. – Oregon Community Trees (OCT) is helping boost Oregon Arbor Month celebrations in six Oregon communities this year thanks to grants the non-profit organization is giving out this spring. Holding a public celebration of Arbor Day is a condition for maintaining Tree City USA status from the national Arbor Day Foundation. OCT Board member Morgan Holen coordinates the grant giving. She said Tree City USA communities receiving grants from OCT this year are:
Coburg Dallas Lake Oswego Pendleton Redmond Rogue River
“We’re happy to be funding Arbor Day events in every part of the state from the Willamette Valley to eastern and southern Oregon,” said Holen. “These events build awareness of the importance of trees to communities and engage residents in direct, memorable ways that buil…
